section.title: PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset Class Reference
section.section:
Member Function Documentation
get_source_class_id() get_source_class_idPeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset PeopleTracker.src.utils.Datasetget_source_class_id
PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.get_source_class_id ( self, class_id, source)
Map an internal class ID to the corresponding class ID in the source dataset.
References PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset._image_ids, and PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.class_info.
image_reference() image_referencePeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset PeopleTracker.src.utils.Datasetimage_reference
PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.image_reference ( self, image_id)
Return a link to the image in its source Website or details about the image that help looking it up or debugging it.
Override for your dataset, but pass to this function if you encounter images not in your dataset.
load_image() load_imagePeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset PeopleTracker.src.utils.Datasetload_image
PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.load_image ( self, image_id)
Load the specified image and return a [H,W,3] Numpy array.
References PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.image_info.
load_mask() load_maskPeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset PeopleTracker.src.utils.Datasetload_mask
PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.load_mask ( self, image_id)
Load instance masks for the given image.
Different datasets use different ways to store masks. Override this method to load instance masks and return them in the form of am array of binary masks of shape [height, width, instances].
Returns: masks: A bool array of shape [height, width, instance count] with a binary mask per instance. class_ids: a 1D array of class IDs of the instance masks.
map_source_class_id() map_source_class_idPeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset PeopleTracker.src.utils.Datasetmap_source_class_id
PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.map_source_class_id ( self, source_class_id)
Takes a source class ID and returns the int class ID assigned to it.
For example: dataset.map_source_class_id("coco.12") -> 23
References PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.class_from_source_map.
prepare() preparePeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset PeopleTracker.src.utils.Datasetprepare
PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.prepare ( self, class_map = None )
Prepares the Dataset class for use.
TODO: class map is not supported yet. When done, it should handle mapping classes from different datasets to the same class ID.
References PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset._image_ids, PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.class_from_source_map, PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.class_ids, PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.class_info, PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.class_names, PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.image_from_source_map, PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.image_ids, PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.image_ids(), PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.image_info, PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.num_classes, PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.num_images, PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.source_class_ids, and PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.sources.
source_image_link() source_image_linkPeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset PeopleTracker.src.utils.Datasetsource_image_link
PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.source_image_link ( self, image_id)
Returns the path or URL to the image. Override this to return a URL to the image if it's available online for easy debugging.
References PeopleTracker.src.utils.Dataset.image_info.
